business.headline: Meta fined Rs 213 crore over WhatsApp privacy policy by competition regulatorThe Competition Commission of India has directed Meta to "cease and desist" from anti-competitive practices.
Sensex, Nifty extend losses amid weak rupee and IT sector declineThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 241.30 points to close at 77,339.01, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 78.90 points to end at 23,453.80.

Will Bitcoin's revival boost India's appetite for cryptos despite high taxes?The crypto market has been riding a wave of optimism following Donald Trump's election as US president, with hopes that his administration will adopt a crypto-friendly stance.

Tata seals deal to acquire 60% of Pegatron's Tamil Nadu iPhone plant: ReportUnder the agreement, Tata will hold a 60% stake in the plant and oversee daily operations, while Pegatron will retain the remaining 40% and provide technical support.

Telangana government announces 100% tax exemption for electric vehiclesThe Telangana government's initiative is a part of its broader electric vehicle policy aimed at creating an eco-friendly transport system while reducing pollution levels in Hyderabad and other urban centres.

Amazon India to move Bengaluru headquarters to cut costs: ReportThe relocation is aimed at reducing costs and will involve vacating 500,000 square feet of office space across 18 floors at the WTC, which is owned by Brigade Enterprises Ltd.

Foxconn tells India recruiters not to ask for marital status in iPhone job adsFoxconn, which employs thousands of women at the iPhone factory at Sriperumbudur, near Chennai, outsources recruitment of assembly-line workers to third-party vendors.

Stock market correction: How bad is the selloff in smallcap and midcap space?Stock Market Correction: Despite aggressive selling by foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) in Indian equities, ICICI Securities recently noted that small-cap and mid-cap indices have shown relative resilience compared to the Nifty.

Gold prices are falling in India but rising globally. 3 reasons whyGold prices have seen a decline, bringing prices closer to lows recorded in September. Globally, however, gold prices have edged higher due to geopolitical and economic factors.

Sensex, Nifty fall as market bloodbath continues. 4 things investors should knowStock market correction: Sensex and Nifty have entered a correction zone, marked by a drop of more than 10% from their recent highs. The sell-off has rattled retail investors, many of whom are now asking a pressing question: Has the market bottomed out, or is there more pain ahead?

Explained: Why Honasa Consumer share price crashed 20% todayHonasa Consumer share price: The sharp drop came after Mamaearth's parent company released its Q2FY25 earnings report, which revealed weaker-than-expected performance.
Gold prices fall further as demand weakens. Check latest rates Gold prices in India have fallen as the precious metal has seen a decline in November as demand for gold weakens globally.

Gold, silver price today, November 18, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today November 18, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Sensex, Nifty open in red dragged by decline in IT stocks; RIL shares down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 420.71 points to 77,159.60, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 132.50 points to 23,400.25.

Final day to buy MRF shares for dividend eligibility ahead of ex-dividend dateThe board of MRF, in its recent meeting, announced the interim dividend while also releasing its financial results for the second quarter that ended on September 30, 2024.
Trading setup for today: What to expect from the stock markets? Last week marked the second consecutive week of losses, as both the Sensex and Nifty declined by nearly 2%.

RIL, Ola Electric, Adani Green, Hero Motocorp: Stocks to watch today Several key stocks, including Hero MotoCorp, Grasim Industries, Adani Green Energy, and Ola Electric, are expected to remain in focus due to second-quarter earnings reports and other updates

Explained: Why Gold has become cheaper in India than in Gulf and SingaporeGold prices in India have become cheaper than in some traditional gold-buying destinations, like the United Arab Emirates, Qatar, Oman, and Singapore.

Why are foreign investors exiting India? 3 reasons behind stock market selloffExperts suggest that the trajectory of future FPI flows will largely depend on how India maintains macroeconomic stability and improves corporate earnings.

NTPC Green Energy IPO: Check key dates, price band, and latest GMPNTPC Green Energy IPO: The IPO is positioned as one of the largest in India this year, alongside Hyundai Motor India Ltd. and Swiggy Ltd. The anchor book will open for subscription on Monday.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Delhi air stays severe plus, overall AQI at 494, most stations touch 500-markAir quality across the national capital region has deteriorated, with several air monitoring stations touching the 500-mark (severe plus) on Tuesday morning.

Elon Musk's SpaceX launches India's 4,700-kg GSAT-20 into spaceThe Indian satellite, also referred to as GSAT-N2, is too heavy for Isro's own rockets to carry, necessitating the first-ever commercial collaboration between Isro and SpaceX.

Atishi blames Centre for Delhi's air apocalypse: Why is PM silent on pollution?Speaking to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Atishi raised concern over the severe air pollution engulfing a large portion of northern India, calling the situation a "medical emergency" caused by rampant stubble burning in several "BJP-ruled" states.

Anil Deshmukh injured after stones thrown at his car in MaharashtraThe incident occurred when Anil Deshmukh was returning from a public meeting in Narkhed, where he was campaigning for his son, Salil Deshmukh, who is contesting the Maharashtra polls as a Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) candidate.

How Diljit Dosanjh's alcohol dare exposes states' hypocrisyCelebrated Punjabi singer Diljit Dosanjh was served a notice and barred from singing songs that referred to alcohol at his Hyderabad concert. In Ahmedabad, the singer, a teetotaller, threw a challenge at the states, exposing their double-standards when it came to liquor policy.

Punjab sees season's highest farm fire cases at 1,251 as Delhi continues to chokeFrom September 15 till November 18, Punjab witnessed 9,655 stubble burning incidents, registering around 71 per cent dip in crop residue burnings in comparison to the figures reported in the corresponding period of the previous year.

Trump picks ex-Congressman, Fox News host Sean Duffy as Transportation SecretaryIf confirmed, Sean Duffy will oversee aviation, automotive, rail, transit and other transportation policies at the department with about a $110 billion budget as well as significant funding that remains under the Biden administration's 2021 $1 trillion infrastructure law and EV charging stations.

Global South needs focus amid food, fuel crisis: PM Modi at G20 SummitThe Indian G20 presidency's call for "One Earth, One Family, One Future" continued to resonate at the Rio conversations, PM Modi said in Rio de Janeiro.

Moment SpaceX deployed India's 4,700-kg GSAT-20 satellite in spaceAlthough India has reportedly launched approximately 430 foreign satellites, this very heavy Indian satellite had to be launched from Florida's Cape Canaveral. This historic collaboration with SpaceX has opened up a new avenue for commercial rocket launches for India.

Trump critics and 'Morning Joe' hosts meet him, agree to 'restart communications'Joe Scarborough and Mika Brzezinski, co-hosts who are married to each other, met US President-elect Donald Trump after a span of seven years.

What Bangladesh-Pakistan direct sea trade link means for regional geopoliticsThe development will be closely watched by the Indian government in the backdrop of the 2004 Chinese arms haul at Chittagong port

Will US-India thrive under Trump amid 'China factor'? Fareed Zakaria explainsWhile speaking to India Today, Fareed Zakaria predicted strengthened US-India ties under Donald Trump, emphasising India's potential to benefit from America's strategic shift away from China in manufacturing and trade.

Indian Coast Guard's 2-hour chase to rescue fishermen caught by Pakistani patrolThe Pakistani ship attempted to retreat after capturing the fishermen but the Indian Coast Guard managed to rescue them.

Post-party drive, attempt to overtake BMW: Timeline of deadly Dehradun crashPolice said that the Innova covered the 600-meter distance from the bus stop to the accident site in just 13 seconds, a speed exceeding 120 km/h.
PM Modi meets Joe Biden at G20 Summit in Rio de Janeiro, says 'always a delight'PM Modi and Joe Biden were also seen shaking hands during the G20 Summit in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

INS Brahmaputra restoration reaches major milestone after fire incidentIn July, a fire broke out onboard the INS Brahmaputra, an Indian Navy warship, while it was undergoing maintenance at the naval dockyard in Mumbai.

Pakistan ready to ease Team India's concerns, no hybrid model: PCB chiefChampions Trophy stand-off: Pakistan Cricket Board chief Mohsin Naqvi reiterated that the board is not willing to host the marquee 50-over tournament in a hybrid model. Naqvi said Pakistan is willing to resolve India's concerns. India have refused to travel to Pakistan for the tournament.

Should Delhi stay India's capital, asks Shashi Tharoor as pollution worsensThiruvananthapuram Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, in yet another attack on the government for not taking action on Delhi's worsening pollution, said that the government has failed to address the issue despite years of worsening air conditions.

Delhi, Patna, Lucknow most polluted cities; Guwahati, Thiruvananthapuram leastOn Tuesday morning, the Air Quality Index in Delhi touched a high of 494 under the 'severe plus' category. Most of the pollution stations today have recorded AQI above 500.

Lawrence Bishnoi's brother detained, US may give custody to Canada: SourcesGangster Anmol Bishnoi, who is wanted in India in multiple cases, was taken into custody in California weeks after the Mumbai Police Crime Branch unit initiated the process of his extradition.

Nayanthara vs Dhanush: Who is right?Nayanthara wrote a loaded open letter to Dhanush over his legal notice regarding unauthorised use of clips from Naanum Rowdy Dhaan in her Netflix documentary. In an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, producers and a lawyer weighed in on the controversy.
Meta fined Rs 213 crore over WhatsApp privacy policy by competition regulatorThe Competition Commission of India has directed Meta to "cease and desist" from anti-competitive practices.

Chhota popat: BJP after Rahul Gandhi mocks PM's 'ek hai toh safe hai' sloganBJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said that Rahul Gandhi inferred that a safe meant 'tijori' as his party had looted the country for decades through various scams.

Ashneer Grover defends himself after Salman Khan schools him on BB 18Ashneer Grover shared a photo with Salman Khan, reiterating his respect for the actor and clarifying their past interactions. The former Shark Tank India judge was schooled by Khan on Bigg Boss 18.

Keerthy Suresh to marry longtime boyfriend Antony Thattil in December: ReportsNational Award-winning actor Keerthy Suresh will reportedly marry her longtime boyfriend, Antony Thattil, in the second week of December. An official announcement regarding the same is expected soon.

Parineeti-Raghav's special gift from actor's mother is 'reflection of love'Parineeti Chopra, and her AAP MP and husband, Raghav Chadha, received a special anniversary gift from the actor's mother, Reena Chopra. The two received special artwork by Reena that defined the couple's love.

Watch: Ram Charan's Durga Devi temple, dargah visit in Andhra sparks fan frenzyActor Ram Charan visited Durga Devi temple and Ameen Peer Dargah in Kadapa, Andhra Pradesh. The actor was the chief guest at the 80th National Mushaira Ghazal event at the Dargah, held today, November 18.

Dilip Joshi denies fallout rumours with Taarak Mehta producer Asit Kumarr Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah actor Dilip Joshi shared a statement and refuted reports about his fallout with the show's producer Asit Modi. The actor shared that it's 'disheartening to see negativity being spread.'

sports.headline: Virat Kohli can find batting form by antagonising Australia: Ravi ShastriBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: With the opening Test in Perth just days away, Ravi Shastri called for Virat Kohli to revisit the fiery, antagonist role that made him a menace for Australian teams early in his career.

Yashasvi will be a better batter when he leaves Australia's shores: Ravi ShastriBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Former Indian coach Ravi Shastri reckons 'world-class' Yashasvi Jaiswal will return as a more polished batter from the Australia tour. Shastri is confident the young opener will rise above the challenges and further refine his game.

Australia's Sam Kerr announces pregnancy with Kristie MewisAustralia's Sam Kerr and Kristie Mewis of the United States are set to become parents. The duo announced it through an Instagram post on Monday.

Have put in enough work: Bowler Mitchell Marsh ready to make it happenAUS vs IND: Mitchell Marsh is set to shoulder added responsibility in the bowling department in Cameron Green's absence during the five-match Test series in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

India held by Malaysia to 1-1 draw, end 2024 winless Rahul Bheke scored in the 39th minute, but Malaysia held India to a 1-1 draw in the International Friendly on Monday at the Gachibowli Stadium in Hyderabad. With the result, India finished 2024 without winning even one of their 11 matches.

Mohammed Shami named in Bengal squad for Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2024-25Star India fast bowler Mohammed Shami has been named in the Bengal squad for the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2024-25. Shami recently made a comeback to professional cricket in the Ranji Trophy.

Pakistan Cricket Board ends Women's Championship after fire incident The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) was forced to suddenly halt the National Women's Championship on Monday after a fire broke out in the team hotel, putting five players in a potentially dangerous situation.

Australia assistant coach Vettori chooses IPL auction over Perth Test: ReportBorder Gavaskar Trophy: Australia have been supportive of assistant coach Daniel Vettori's decision to attend the IPL auction in Jeddah during the Perth Test. Vettori is the head coach of SunRisers Hyderabad.

IPL 2025 auction: Irfan backs this India star to break Mitchell Starc's recordFormer India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has backed wicketkeeper batter to break Mitchell Starc's record of being the most expensive player at an IPL auction.

Who is Omkar Salvi? RCB appoint new bowling coach for IPL 2025Omkar Salvi has joined Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) as their bowling coach for the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025. Salvi was earlier with the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR), who won the IPL last season.

Rafael Nadal keen on not making Davis Cup his farewell show: 'Not here to retire'Davis Cup Finals: Rafael Nadal acknowledged the buzz in Malaga around his retirement, but the Spaniard said he doesn't want to make it a spectacle. Nadal added he is focused on helping the team win, regardless of whether he gets to play.

Drop Babar Azam, save Pakistan cricket: Fans slam batter after 3rd T20IAUS vs PAK: Babar Azam had to face criticism for his lack of impact after Pakistan lost the third and final T20I against Australia by seven wickets at the Bellerive Oval in Hobart.

Virat Kohli reveals his favourite hundred in Australia. It's not Adelaide 2014Star India batter Virat Kohli revealed his most favourite century in Australia in a recent video shared by the BCCI. Kohli has scored six Test centuries in Australia from 13 matches.

Pakistan opener calls for T20I team revamp: Whitewash in Australia embarrassingAustralia vs Pakistan: In a strongly-worded statement, out-of-favour opener Ahmad Shahzad lashed out at the senior men's team after they were whitewashed 0-3 in a T20I series. Pakistan appoint Aaqib Javed as interim white-ball head coach Pakistan have appointed Aaqib Javed as the interim head coach of the Pakistan men's national team until the Champions Trophy to be held next year from February 19 to March 9.
First look at Perth pitch ahead of opening Test matchIndia are set to play their opening Test match of the series in Perth. Here's the first look of the pitch at the Optus Stadium in Perth.

Hopefully Kohli will not have too many moments over 5 Tests: Travis HeadAustralia batter Travis Head has hoped that Virat Kohli will not have too many good moments in India's tour of Australia. Head said that Australia respect Kohli for the world-class player that he is.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
